intro: Psychotria tylophora, commonly known as the "Cape York psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of northern Australia and parts of New Guinea. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant has a woody stem and can grow as an herb or shrub, depending on environmental conditions.
